info.headline: Air Stagnation Advisory issued January 17 at 6:33AM MST until January 21 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Boise
info.description: ...AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST FRIDAY... ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Air Stagnation Advisory, an extended period of stagnant air, with light winds and little vertical mixing. For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility less than 1/4 mile at times in dense fog. * WHERE...Western Magic Valley. * WHEN...For the Air Stagnation Advisory, until 11 AM MST Friday. For the Dense Fog Advisory, until 11 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. Periods of air stagnation can lead to the buildup of pollutants near the surface.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you. An Air Stagnation Advisory concerns itself with meteorological conditions only. For more information on air pollution in Idaho, visit website www.deq.idaho.gov. If possible, reduce or eliminate activities that contribute to air pollution, such as outdoor burning, and the use of residential wood burning devices. Reduce vehicle trips and vehicle idling as much as possible.
